title: DistrictView
text:
DistrictView is the largest collection of school board meetings ever assembled and publicly released. We identify, process, clean, and publicly release data on school board meetings as posted on YouTube.
DistrictView is a project co-led by two researchers working alongside a dedicated and brilliant team of data scientists, project managers, and others; more about them here!

Tyler Simko, Postdoctoral Fellow at Princeton University and Incoming Assistant Professor of Political Science at the University of Michigan

Rebecca Johnson, Assistant Professor in Computational Social Science at Georgetown’s McCourt School of Public Policy.
DistrictView is a companion project to LocalView, by Soubhik Barari and Tyler Simko.
The project is also generously supported by funders we thank here.

title: Funders
text:
We’re deeply grateful for the generous support of funders who have made this project possible! We’d like to acknowledge the receipt of funding from:
Georgetown McCourt School’s Tech & Public Policy (TPP) Grant Program

The National Academy of Education (NAEd) + Spencer Foundation Postdoctoral Fellowship

Georgetown McCourt School’s Massive Data Institute (MDI) Scholars Program

title: DistrictView
text:
DistrictView is the largest collection of school board meetings ever assembled and publicly released. We identify, process, clean, and publicly release data on school board meetings as posted on YouTube.
DistrictView is a project by Tyler Simko, Postdoctoral Fellow at Princeton University, and Rebecca Johnson, Assistant Professor at Georgetown’s McCourt School of Public Policy.
DistrictView is a companion project to LocalView, by Soubhik Barari and Tyler Simko.
